intro: Ceropegia ngoyana, commonly known as the Ngoyana milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky surfaces or in sandy soils. Its unique floral structure attracts specific pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
